mint.poetic_text: The plan of such a house will be characteristically different from all other houses. It need only be a room.

lavender.poetic_text: I am reintroducing species to areas in which they had formerly thrived. Reclaiming. Relocation. Even the accidental.

raspberry.political_pairing: Youth Ministries for Peace and Justice
raspberry.poetic_text: A rally mobilized 1,200 people and resulted in dance, music, muraling, film, poetry...

chamomile.poetic_text: Agro-enterprises. Miners. All around the world. Lending.

dandelion.poetic_text: I wrote his project proposal and he made my design in glass.

violet.poetic_text: Living as an integral component in our small world. This effort confirms the fact that we rely on the life systems for survival, and at the same time, the ecological systems depend upon our efforts.

marigold.poetic_text: The system stores and creates energy throughout the day. Any extra energy flows back onto the grid. It is self-healing.

rose.poetic_text: Coordinated patterns of greater and greater diversity.

bee.poetic_text: The shocks—earthquakes, fires, floods, etc.—the stresses that weaken the fabric of a city on a day to day or cyclical basis. high unemployment; endemic violence; chronic food and water shortages.

elderflower.poetic_text: In every way, shape, and form, we are at war. Art can cultivate systemic social change. Art can transform people’s perceptions about value, and collective art forms can reframe predominant ideologies.

ant.poetic_text: Repositories are places where writers can share their work with the world and solicit feedback, while others can fork the story and make their own variation.

apple.poetic_text: We are dynamically prepared for the rapid changes occurring in our global climate, energy, and economic systems. Families, communities, businesses, and governments work collaboratively for a graceful and ethical transition.

pear.poetic_text: Fieldworks. Lead poisoning. Pop up bookstore. Rebel coffee service. Bioremediation.

lemon.poetic_text: A floating barge, a functional model. A space for human enjoyment of the water.
